seo.title: Cairo Metro
seo.description: Cairo Metro is the first underground railway system in Africa and the Arab world. It is one of the most important means of transportation in Cairo and Giza, and it is the fastest means of transportation in the two governorates, as it is the only means of transportation that is not affected by traffic congestion in the two governorates.

question1.title: How to subscribe to Cairo Metro?
question1.answer: Create a new account by registering with your personal information and a valid email address or phone number. Navigate to the {0} section of the platform. Select the subscription that meets your needs and process with the payment details.

question2.title: How much does the Cairo Metro cost?
question2.answer: The cost of a single journey on the Cairo Metro depends on the distance traveled. Currently, the fare ranges from X to Y Egyptian pounds.

question3.title: What are the Cairo Metro Opening Hours?
question3.answer: The Cairo Metro operates from 5:00 am to 12:00 am daily. However, the schedule may vary on public holidays or special occasions.

question4.title: Can children travel for free?
question4.answer: Children under 3 years old can travel for free on the Cairo Metro. Children between the ages of 3 and 9 years old are eligible for discounted fares.

question5.title: Can you take food and drink onto the trains?
question5.answer: Eating and drinking are not allowed on the Cairo Metro trains. However, passengers are allowed to carry bottled water or other non-alcoholic drinks with them. It is recommended to keep the train cars clean and dispose of any trash properly.
